author: sba923
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```
Compress-Archive -LiteralPath d:\tmp\somedir -DestinationPath d:\tmp\somearchive.zip
```

# Expected behavior

The resulting archive should have the following contents (as displayed by '7z.exe l')

```
7-Zip 19.00 (x64) : Copyright (c) 1999-2018 Igor Pavlov : 2019-02-21

Scanning the drive for archives:
1 file, 475290 bytes (465 KiB)

Listing archive: D:\tmp\somedir-7z.zip

--
Path = D:\tmp\somedir-7z.zip
Type = zip
Physical Size = 475290

   Date      Time    Attr         Size   Compressed  Name
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------  ------------------------
2019-09-14 19:45:09 D....            0            0  somedir
2019-09-11 21:52:37 ....A       489436       474779  somedir\fintech - Wikipedia - EN.pdf
2018-09-01 08:08:28 ....A           15           15  somedir\someotherfile.txt
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------  ------------------------
2019-09-14 19:45:09             489451       474794  2 files, 1 folders

```
(this is an archive created by 7-Zip, not by Windows Explorer)

# Actual behavior


The archive created by `Compress-Archive` has the following contents:

```
7-Zip 19.00 (x64) : Copyright (c) 1999-2018 Igor Pavlov : 2019-02-21

Scanning the drive for archives:
1 file, 475247 bytes (465 KiB)

Listing archive: D:\tmp\somedir-PS.zip

--
Path = D:\tmp\somedir-PS.zip
Type = zip
Physical Size = 475247

   Date      Time    Attr         Size   Compressed  Name
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------  ------------------------
2019-09-11 21:52:36 .....       489436       474934  somedir\fintech - Wikipedia - EN.pdf
2018-09-01 08:08:28 .....           15           17  somedir\someotherfile.txt
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------  ------------------------
2019-09-11 21:52:36             489451       474951  2 files
```
Note the 'blank' attributes, and the lack of a directory entry.

This causes such an archive to be rejected by some applications (Kodi to be specific).

Note that this is not PS7-specific, I get the same results with PS6.2.3 or Windows PowerShell 5.1

With a larger test set with many subdirectories, the archive created by `Compress-Archive` contains only one directory object, all other directories in the source tree are missing from the archive.

# Environment data

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

````
PS 7.0.0-preview.4 //pnjnas/pi/kodi> gcm compress-archive

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Function        Compress-Archive                                   1.2.3.0    Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive
````
